Reviews.Content: Awfull experience This was the most unpleasant experience I ever met; like almost all the others in Italy. Four stars means two stars. The room was supposed to be with an old and beautiful furniture, the services were very bad almost inexistent form four to four days, the personnel was very bad trained actually one could met someone only from 12 to 7, the clothes were dirty , the shower was uncomfortable and inappropriate not to speak about the garage that was very expensive.There was no view, the television and the remotecontrol were disable.All in all it was the most unpleasant holyday ever met.
Reviews.Author: Oana2000

Reviews.Content: Amazing Location We had a spacious apartment that overlooked the piazza between the Baptistery and the Duomo. The location could not have been more superb. The apartment had all amenities, including a kitchen, and wonderful twelve foot ceilings. When it got too hot in the afternoon, we could sit in our living room and look out over the piazza. Tremendous location and wonderful hospitality.
Reviews.Author: Sbb1218

Reviews.Content: Great location We spent 3 nights here and it was the perfect location to walk everywhere famous in Florence! We had 3 apartments as we were travelling together as 3 families. Like all other reviewers, only 2 of the burners on the stove worked, oven didn't work, and both showers flooded the bathroom in each of our rooms! Large fridge was very useful. Very large family room areas - it was good to have some space after using hotel rooms for a couple of weeks. That said, we would probably book these apartments again as the location is perfect. As we were in Florence in winter just before Christmas, there were no queues at the Uffizi or David or anywhere else we went! We didn't have rain so it worked out to be a great time to visit Florence.
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum

Reviews.Content: Fabulous place but caution on noise level As a native Italian living in the USA, I travel to Italy several times a year with my family of 5 and on business. In July 2007 our family stayed two times at the Palazzo Gamba. The only problem we encountered was the noise level from the first floor apartment we were given during our 2nd stay. We did not have a problem at all during our 1st stay as the 1st apartment was higher up and faced the street on side of Duomo, plus it had one inner bedroom that was not on any street. The 1st flor apartment we had during our 2nd stay was directly over a busy street (Via Martelli) and did not have sound proof windows. This led to 2 nights of no sleep due to noise of buses, street cleaners, cars, vespas, all night long. Although we asked to be moved to a different apartment, there were no vacancies. So only word of caution - ask for an apartment on high floor, not facing Via Martelli and with sound proof windows. Otherwise 鈥?beautiful apartments, simply equipped kitchen with dishwasher; bathrooms were small but clean, plenty of towels, great location.Only one key is provided which makes it diffiult for familes or friends going in 2 different directions for the day.Front desk staff helpful and coureous.
Reviews.Author: Italiacalcio

Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, extremely noisy Our family of 5 spent 7 nights in the Botticelli Apartment. Two-bedrooms on the 3rd floor with frescoed ceilings and a view of the duomo and baptistry. There was a small kitchen area, two of the four burners worked on the stove and a large refrigerator. There is a grocery store close by, which we took advantage of. The bus stop is across the street as is the ATM machine. Negatives, the noise level is extremely high - young people hang out of the steps of the church til at least 2 a.m. each night singing and drinking. Four ambulances are stationed across the street and are constantly on the go, sirens wailing at all hours. The beds are extremely hard and fairly uncomfortable. The bathrooms (2) were both very small with leaky showers that drained very slowly.Positives: Location, location, location. It couldn't be beat. In several minutes you could be at the Ponte Vecchio, The Uffizi, Accademia, Boboli Gardens, Piazza della Signora, The Pitti Palace, or just strolling along the Arno. Cristiano and Jessica were very helpful at the check-in. But as has been pointed out, the hours of 12 noon to 8 p.m. are not convenience if you have a late flight from the United States and arrive in Florence at 9 a.m. It is a 15 minutes taxi ride from the airport to the hotel. Cost about 25 Euros plus an additional 1 euro for each bag. We needed two taxis. The weather was extremely warm for October. It was in the 80's every day and no rain. The city was more crowded than I expected it to be. The tour books tell you October is quieter, but it wasn't true. Shop owners we talked with said September and October are becoming as busy as June and July. Because of the weak dollar, the cost was about $360 a night.Would we stay here again, yes, because of the location and convenience but certainly not because of a quiet, relaxing atmosphere as the hotel advertises.
Reviews.Author: Italy4X

Reviews.Content: What a View! This was an amazing experience. It won the prize for the best views in Italy. My husband and I as well as two friends stayed here for three nights. It was the best location for walking around the city. We were in the penthouse so the view was amazing. We spent every night sitting on our deck and we felt like we could lean out and touch the Duomo. The kitchen was small but quite adequate. The shower in one of the bathrooms was tiny and flooded the floor. It was also noisy. Earplugs solved that problem. That said the location and the views won out and we loved our stay here.
Reviews.Author: aussieches

Reviews.Content: Fantastic find in the historic center of Florence I often turn to Trip Advisor reviews for guidance so I was surprised to find only eight, somewhat dated, but very good reviews about Palazzo Gamba on TA (but I did find lots of positive reviews on another popular website). The small number of reviews made me a bit apprehensive to book (2) two-bedroom apartments at the Palazzo Gamba for our family鈥檚 4-night stay in Florence, but as it turns out, I鈥檓 so glad I did and I鈥檓 delighted to share information on this fantastic find!The apartment building is in the historic center of Florence, about 40+ feet from the Duomo. It鈥檚 within a 10 minute walking radius to all the major sights: Piazza della Signoria, Accademia, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio, Santa Croce, San Lorenzo market, Medici Chapels, etc. The start of the pedonale - pedestrian zone - is across the street from the apartment.We had the Raffaello and the Leonardo apartments on the 2nd floor. These are the only ones with balconies overlooking the Duomo and Battistero. Both apartments were VERY spacious and clean. In addition to the beds, each apartment had a sleeper sofa. Having a small kitchen fully supplied with kitchenware was an added convenience. We didn鈥檛 use it for cooking as there were so many great restaurant options nearby, but we did make good use of the fridge for our drinks and the kettle and cups for tea.The relatively minor shortcomings are: the lobby is small and unimpressive (I was initially worried about the place when we walked into the lobby, but it鈥檚 not a good indicator of what鈥檚 to come); the elevator is small and can accommodate about 3 people (you might have to make a couple trips if you have lots of luggage); and the surrounding area is not exactly quiet at night as it鈥檚 in the historic, well-visited section of town (for those bothered by noise in the evening, ear plugs should do the trick!). With these things aside, everything else is top notch. A few things to know about: 鈥he reception desk is only available between 12noon 鈥?7:30pm, so if you need front desk help, you must check in or make inquiries during these hours. 鈥owels are changed every few days unless you request a set of fresh towels daily (for a flat fee of 10 euro) which will cover the entire stay, not per day.鈥anielle and Cristiano at the reception desk were very helpful during the booking process and throughout our stay. They can also book tours. 鈥ou鈥檒l only have one (large) key set for each apartment; included is a key for the building and one for the safe. 鈥ooms can be rung up from outside the building as there are door bells labeled with the room name; a video cam allows you to see who is ringing your room from outside.鈥here鈥檚 a cafeteria style deli next to the apartment that serves sandwiches and salads. 鈥lose by is the wonderful pasticceria, Robiglio鈥檚 鈥?a great place to have your morning pastry and cappuccino. 鈥he bus stop is across the street.Palazzo Gamba was such a great find! If you鈥檙e looking for comfortable convenience with lots of space at a reasonable price, Palazzo Gamba would be perfect for family or friends traveling together.
Reviews.Author: itsasmallworld

Reviews.Content: A Room With A View We rented a two bedroom apartment. It was on the second floor.It was nice for our family of four and a family friend. As my family have one of the bedroom facing the Duomo and my friend has the other bed room. We had nice high ceiling. There are two small bathrooms off the living room area.It was bit noisy but we got used to it.The kitchen was ok. You can't turn on two burners at the same time on the stove, otherwise you will have to go down stair to flip the power switch. AC was adequet as we had 90 F temperature weather.No daily towel services, cost 10 Euro extra, don't know if it is daily or the whole stay. Elevator is very small but we usually just walk up.My family and I would stay there again because of the location, convinience and spaciousness of the facility.
Reviews.Author: familyWChildren

Reviews.Content: good 4 kids except I travelled with my husband, 2 small children and my parents in September 2006 and have to say that the location of this property is outstanding. From our apartment named aptly Leonardo we could see the Duomo and the Baptistry. The wonderful thing about that is you could check on the queues for both places without leaving your loungeroom and plan a quick visit when the queue is short. The bells, well yes they can be a bit irritating, but i prefer to think of them as charming, and they definitely didn't spoil my experience or that of my 18 month old or 4 year old. Florence is very noisy, sirens are also a problem, but we all slept soundly (we got used to the noise and kept windows and doors closed at night). The airconditioning functioned very well, as did the dishwasher. The bathroom/shower had a flood problem, due to the tiny shower pan and inappropriate material shower curtains. For couples travelling with children, excellent location as you don't waste time on public transport and the Carregi hospital is a 15 minute bus ride (hospital is very good there by the way!). Lack of bath is a big problem for kids especially with such a problematic and small shower. I actually bathed my 18 month old in the kitchen sink!! Lack of toaster and kettle and decent sized mugs was the thing which really annoyed us. The lift could also be a problem as it was so small I had to fold my pram to fit it in, which meant obviously I had to remove my small child from it. The doorman would watch me impassively as I struggled to hold my child and fold the pram at the same time, never once offering to help me. These gripes aside the image I take away of Florence is the view from the Leonardo apartment and that thought always brings a smile to my face. Some tips travelling with small child/children you CANNOT travel without a pram! The kids will love the double decker red Florence sighseeing bus, even my 18 month old loved it and we found it worth the 20 euro, my kids 4 yrs and 18 months were free and you get another trip to Fiesole (in the nearby hills) included. The Uffizi lines are crazy, I got there at 9am and still had to wait 1hr and a half. I DID NOT bring the kids, small children will not appreciate the queue nor the artworks! Enjoy Florence!
Reviews.Author: Mumi-Goez

Reviews.Content: Back in a Heartbeat On a recent three week trip to Europe, this was the best apartment that we stayed in. The location is fantastic (look out your window at the Duomo), the bedrooms and the living space are large, the unit is well equiped and the price represents an excellent value.We traveled as a family of five with three teenagers. This was the one apartment on our trip with absolutely no complaints. The living area in our apartment had a 15' high ceiling with a fresco on it - definately not your standard fare. The kitchen was well equiped (including a dishwasher), daily maid service was included and, most importantly, the air conditioning was very effective. The apartment is located in the center of town making any destination a 15 minute walk or less. We were able to see one or two sites in the morning, retreat out of the afternoon heat into air conditioned bliss for a breather for a couple of hours and then resume our city exploration late in the afternoon or in the early evening.We have already recommended the apartment to several friends.
Reviews.Author: LA_Food_Guy

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Location, Great Apartment I would thoroughly recommend anyone to stay at Palazzo Gamba in Florence. We booked via venere.com and got a really good rate for a huge two bedroomed apartment. Each bedroom had an ensuite, and there was a large lounge/dining/kitchen area. The size of the apartment would have made it great, but what was even better, was the view of the Duomo, directly from our lounge window. The airconditioning kept the place cool, so even in the heat of Florence, we were very comfortable. When we return to Florence we will stay here again.
Reviews.Author: NickyU

Reviews.Content: The Heart of Town but Bring Your Earplugs The apartment buidling is literally across the street from the Duomo in the heart of town. We were escorted up to our 2 bedroom apartment which was absolutely HUGE and we discovered one of the bedrooms looked out onto the Duomo plaza. Talk about great pictures!! The location is a 2 minute walk to the Central Market and 10 wonderful minutes from the Bargello, Uffizi, etc. etc. Florence is small enought that you can get anywhere really fast.Anyway, the apartment was very nice and the reception desk personnel are very helpful with regard to finding and making restaurant reservations (don't miss Antico Borgo, Mama Gina, Aqua al Due for dinner and Antico Noe for a quick sandwich for lunch...amazing!!)ONE PIECE OF ADVICE...if you want the location and the nice spacious apartment, BRING SOME EARPLUGS!! This area is loud. Not only church bells as was noted in the prior reviewer but just general partying until about 2am!! And the taxis and noice start up again by 6am. Get your museum reservations in advance and consider getting a Michaelangelo tour of some sort.
Reviews.Author: Steiny

Reviews.Content: For whom the bell tolls... First, let me say something I've never read anywhere about Firenze. Not in guide books, not online, not in trip reviews from friends. If you stay anywhere near the Duomo, be advised that the Duomo bells start ringing - loudly - at 7 am and ring every 15 minutes for the next hour. And I'm not talking charming just married, happy, sing-songy church bells. These are serious Repent, Ye Sinners type church bells. No sleeping after 7. Especially at Palazzo Gamba. I booked Palazzo Gamba based on reader reviews on this and other travel sites at the last minute after a problem with a reservation at another property. It was easy to find and literally in the shadow of the Duomo. Friendly, wonderful Catarina showed us to the 1-bedroom apartment we booked. It was small and smelled strongly of cleaning products, but okay. Great view of the San Lorenzo dome! The bathroom was tiny and had one of the showers that would inevitably flood the floor. Our travel companions wanted to see if there was a larger apartment and Catarina obliged and showed us the available 2 bedroom apartment - Giambiatta (I think that's the name - it's the only one on the 4th floor). The second apartment was much larger and had 2 bedrooms with 1-1/2 baths. The down-side was that it offered no view. But, we weren't spending a ton of time during the day in the apartment, so we sacrificed the view and took the bigger apartment. This apartment had no air conditioning and four windows. The two large windows opened onto what I can only describe as an air shaft in the middle of the building. No big deal - we didn't care about the view - except that if you wanted ventilation, you had to listen to the very loud water pump clanking on and off constantly. The air shaft also had some standing water at the bottom which created a bit of a mosquito problem too. Italy has some crazy mosquitos. So, we had to sleep with the windows closed. The front windows opened to the street. A night club a few doors down was pretty happening, so people partying and loud music kept our friends awake along with the traffic noises and sirens of a big city. The full bath was enormous, but poorly designed. A glass shelf above the sink was the only storage. It was too wide to wash one's face without hitting one's head. The shower was a tiny pan with a fabric curtain too short to reach the edge of the pan. Once soaked, the water dripped all over the floor and flooded the room. The beds were hard. The closet was giant - great storage for an extended stay. Linen service is only every 4th day, so either pay for extra linen service or ration your towel usage. Catarina at the desk was delightful! She was only there the first day. The man who was there the rest of our stay was pretty cold and didn't speak great English. I tried in Italian, but I think that made things worse. Desk staff is there from noon to 8 pm. If you need something earlier, you're out of luck. Because Palazzo Gamba is in the limited traffic zone. If you have a car, you'll need to register your car at the desk so they can notify the police not to ticket you.I don't think I'd stay here again. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. At 鈧?20 a night, I think I could have found something better. Maybe if you get one of the apartments with the fresco ceilings and full-sized windows, you'd enjoy it more. And if you are a heavy sleeper who gets up very early on vacation, you'll be fine!
Reviews.Author: blondeinabmw

Reviews.Content: Palazzo Gambo - one of the best apartments I've stayed in. My sister and I have just come back from Florence where we stayed in the Palazzo Gamba Residence (it's real name is Residence San Lorenzo) in Florence. I've been to Italy a few times and this is definately one of the best apartments I've been in. We had a one bedroom apartment, on the 6th floor (second top floor) with a view of the Duomo and the Bapistry almost within touching distance - stunning!The rooms were good sized, especially the bedroom (compared to most European hotel rooms). Decor and kitchen were fine (althoughit had no basics like salt and pepper or a kettle, but it didn't matter too much). There was a sofa bed in the living room too, so plenty of space.The lady on reception was brilliant, really friendly, getting us booked on tours and giving us information about supermarkets, restuarants etc. The noise from the street below  the square was noticeable, but the cars really quietened down by early evening and it was just mainly people chattering as they went past - anyway we both slept like babies.I would recommend anyone to stay here if they visit Florence - it is definately better value than any of the other hotels I've stayed in on my previous 2 visits there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat! Will stay here again       View from window (Duomo on left)
Reviews.Author: PleaseDont

Reviews.Content: Palazzo Gamba Apartment - Great Location       Looking out the living room window
